Arizona Christian University Data & Information Overview

76% Acceptance Rate23% Student Loan Default Rate

Want to know more about a specific stat? Just click on its tile, and youâll go to a page that goes more in-depth on that subject. You can also use the links below to go directly to any section on this page.

Overall Quality

Arizona Christian University was not ranked in College Factual's 2024 Best Overall Colleges report. This could be for a number of reasons, including lack of data.

See all of the rankings for Arizona Christian University.

Is It Hard to Get Into Arizona Christian University?

76% Acceptance Rate37% Of Accepted Are Women13% Submit SAT Scores

Acceptance Rate

When it comes to admittance, Arizona Christian University is somewhat selective. Its acceptance rate is 76%, which means you'll face some strong competition during the admissions process. Do what you can to make your application stand out.

Average Test Scores

About 13% of students accepted to Arizona Christian University submitted their SAT scores. When looking at the 25th through the 75th percentile, SAT Evidence-Based Reading and Writing scores ranged between 480 and 590. Math scores were between 480 and 580.

SAT Reading and Writing Scores for Arizona Christian University Â ( 480 to 590 )

SAT Math Scores for Arizona Christian University Â ( 480 to 580 )

Arizona Christian University received ACT scores from 22% of accepted students. When looking at the 25th through the 75th percentile, ACT Composite scores ranged between 16 and 23.

ACT Composite Scores for Arizona Christian University Â ( 16 to 23 )

Learn more about Arizona Christian University admissions.

Arizona Christian University Faculty

18 to 1 Student to Faculty28% Full Time Teachers

Student to Faculty Ratio

The student to faculty ratio at Arizona Christian University is about average at 18 to 1. This ratio is often used to gauge how many students might be in an average class and how much time professors will have to spend with their students on an individual level. The national average for this metric is 15 to 1.

Percent of Full-Time Faculty

In addition to the student to faculty ratio, some people look at what percentage of faculty members are full-time as a sign of how much time professors will be able to spend with their students. This is because part-time teachers may not be be on campus as much as their full-time counterparts.

The full-time faculty percentage at Arizona Christian University is 28%. This is lower than the national average of 47%.

Full-Time Faculty Percent Â 28 out of 100

Retention and Graduation Rates at Arizona Christian University

48% Freshmen Retention36% On-Time Graduation Rate

Freshmen Retention Rate

The freshmen retention rate of 48% tells us that most first-year, full-time students don't stick around for a second year at Arizona Christian University. Students may have a variety of reasons for this, such as only intending to attend a school for one year while they brush up on certain subjects.

Freshmen Retention Rate Â 48 out of 100

Graduation Rate

The on-time graduation rate is the percent of first-time, full-time students who get their bachelor's degree with four years. At Arizona Christian University this rate is 36%, which is about average when compared to the national rate of 33.3%.

On-Time Graduation Rate Â 36 out of 100

Find out more about the retention and graduation rates at Arizona Christian University.

Arizona Christian University Undergraduate Student Diversity

779 Full-Time Undergraduates51.6% Racial-Ethnic Minorities*37.1% Percent Women

During the 2017-2018 academic year, there were 925 undergraduates at Arizona Christian University with 779 being full-time and 146 being part-time.

How Much Does Arizona Christian University Cost?

$29,065 Net Price93% Take Out Loans$25,604 Total Student Loans

The overall average net price of Arizona Christian University is $29,065. The affordability of the school largely depends on your financial need since net price varies by income group. See the table below for the net price for different income groups.

Net Price by Income Group for Arizona Christian University

The net price is calculated by adding tuition, room, board and other costs and subtracting financial aid.Note that the net price is typically less than the published for a school. For more information on the sticker price of Arizona Christian University, see our tuition and fees and room and board pages.

Student Loan Debt

Almost 66% of college students who graduated with the class of 2018 took out student loans, but that percentage varies from school to school. At Arizona Christian University, approximately 93% of students took out student loans averaging $6,401 a year. That adds up to $25,604 over four years for those students.

The student loan default rate at Arizona Christian University is 22.5%. Watch out! This is significantly higher than the national default rate of 10.1%, which means you could have trouble paying back your student loans if you take any out.

Get more details about paying for Arizona Christian University.

How Much Money Do Arizona Christian University Graduates Make?

$37,531 Avg Salary of GradsHigh Earnings Boost

The pay for some majors is higher than others, but on average, students who graduate with a bachelor's degree from Arizona Christian University make about $37,531 a year during their first few years of employment after graduation. Unfortunately, this is 12% less that the average college graduate's salary of $42,485 per year. However, graduates in your major field may make more.

See which majors at Arizona Christian University make the most money.

Location of Arizona Christian University

Arizona State779 Full-Time UndergraduatesSuburb Campus Setting

Arizona Christian University is a private not-for-profit institution located in Glendale, Arizona. Glendale is considered a suburb and offers tranquility and safety near the excitement of a city center.

Get more details about the location of Arizona Christian University.

Contact details for Arizona Christian University are given below.

Arizona Christian University Majors

11 Majors With Completions128 Undergraduate Degrees

Learn more about the majors offered at Arizona Christian University along with which ones have the highest average starting salaries.

Online Learning at Arizona Christian University

24% Take At Least One Class Online12% Take All Classes Online

Online learning options are becoming more and more popular at American colleges and universities. Online classes are great for students who have busy schedules or for those who just want to study on their own time.

In 2020-2021, 256 students took at least one online class at Arizona Christian University. This is a decrease from the 302 students who took online classes the previous year.

Learn more about online learning at Arizona Christian University.
